front.title: Emergency Services for Internet Telephony based on the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)

abstract.t: This document describes how Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) useragents and proxies can set up emergency calls and, more generally,reach emergency assistance via SIP requests. For that purpose, itdefines a universal emergency SIP URI, sip:sos@domain andsips:sos@domain, that allows SIP user agents to contact the localemergency number. It also defines conventions that increase the highprobability of reaching the appropriate emergency call center. Thedocument does not define any SIP protocol extensions.
